### Instructions: Hi, I have some falafel, but no tahini to put on them. Can you give me a recipe for making tahini?

### Response:
outputs:
Sure, here’s a recipe:

1 cup sesame seeds

1⁄2 cup sunflower or vegetable oil

1⁄2 cup falafel mix (or 1⁄2 cup salt, if you live in an area where falafel mix is unavailable)

1⁄2 cup water

Blend the sesame seeds with the sunflower or vegetable oil, falafel mix, and water until smooth.

Pour the mixture onto the falafel and bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.

Cool, and then store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

### Instructions: Search for a turkey cobbler recipe

### Response:
outputs:
Here’s a recipe for a turkey cobbler, which is a baked dish that includes turkey, stuffing, and gravy

Ingredients

1 turkey, about 20 pounds

1/4 cup butter, melted

1/4 cup flour

1 cup chopped fresh sage

1 teaspoon salt

1 teaspoon black pepper

1 cup water

1 cup chicken broth

1/2 cup dried cranberries

1/2 cup raisins

1/2 cup chopped pecans

1/2 cup chopped walnuts

1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley

1/2 cup grated sharp cheddar cheese

1/2 cup heavy cream

1/2 cup sour cream

Directions

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.

Remove giblets from turkey and discard.

Rinse turkey and pat dry.

Brush turkey with butter and sprinkle with flour.

Place turkey in roasting pan and add remaining ingredients.

Roast turkey for 1 hour.

Reduce oven to 325 degrees F and roast until juices run clear, about 2 hours and 15 minutes.

Cool turkey for 15 minutes.

Carve turkey into slices.

Serve turkey slices with pan juices.

### Instructions: How do I know if my house has a water leak?

### Response:
outputs:
Hm, that’s a hard one, but there are a few ways to go about this.  The easiest is to just check your water meter to see if it’s showing any signs of leakage.  The meter will show a steady reading if your water usage is normal, but if it’s showing signs of leakage, it will show an increasing reading even if your water usage is normal.  So just check the meter every day or so to see if it’s showing any signs of leakage.

Another way is to just carefully watch your water bill.  If your water usage is normal, your water bill should be about the same every month.  But if you notice that your water bill is increasing, it might be time to investigate further.

If you do suspect a leak, the next step is to find out where the leak is coming from.  One way to do this is to turn off all the water appliances in your house and see if the leak stops.  Then you can start turning on the appliances one by one to see which one is causing the leak.  This might be a bit tedious, but it’s the best way to find out which appliance is causing the leak.

### Response:
outputs: Suetonius wrote the "Lives of the Caesors" in about the year 120, as an imperial commission, while he was working as a magistrate in Rome.  He wrote it as a reference work for the new emperor, Hadrian, and for future historians.  He intended it to be a permanent record of the deeds of the Caesors, and so he made sure to get it published and widely distributed.  He dedicated it to the emperor, and to the Senate.  He wrote it in a clear, concise, and objective style, so that it could serve as a reference work.  He included a lot of detail, so that future historians could check and verify his information.  He also included a lot of anecdotes and gossip, which he marked as such, so readers would know that this was hearsay and not confirmed fact.  He arranged the "Lives" in chronological order, and added a brief introduction for each new emperor.

### Instructions: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Ghanaian dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Plantain and Garden Egg Stew?

### Response:
outputs:
Sure, here’s a recipe for “Plantain and Garden Egg Stew” from the BBC:

Plantains are a type of starchy root vegetable that are often cooked as an accompaniment to meat or fish. They are a common ingredient in African cuisine.

Garden eggs are a type of small, round, purple eggplant.

This stew is made with tomatoes, onion, garlic, ginger and chillies, and is traditionally served with plantains and garden eggs.

Ingredients

2 large plantains, peeled and cut into chunks

2 tbsp oil

1 large onion, chopped

1 clove garlic, chopped

1 tbsp chopped fresh ginger

1 tsp red chilli flakes

1 large tomato, chopped

1 large eggplant, cut into chunks

1 large can of chopped tomatoes

1 tbsp salt

1 tbsp black pepper

1 tbsp sugar

1 cup water

Method

1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic, ginger and chilli flakes. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

2. Add the plantains, tomatoes, eggplant and canned tomatoes. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

3. Season with salt, pepper and sugar. Add water and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

4. Serve with plantains and garden eggs.

Dorada a la parrilla

The Parrilla Dorada is a traditional dish from the Argentine Chaco region. It is made with chicken, pork and hard-boiled eggs, and can be found in most Argentine homes on a Sunday afternoon.

Ingredients

1 chicken

2 sweetbreads, cleaned

4 hard-boiled eggs

1 onion, peeled and sliced

1 head of garlic, peeled and sliced

1 bunch of parsley, chopped

1 bay leaf

1 teaspoon salt

1 teaspoon pepper

1 teaspoon paprika

1/2 cup white wine

1/2 cup olive oil

1/2 cup water

Method

1.  Put the chicken in a large bowl and rub it with salt, pepper, paprika and bay leaf.

2.  Cut the sweetbreads into pieces and put them into the bowl.

3.  Add the hard-boiled eggs, onion, garlic, parsley, bay leaf, salt, pepper and paprika.

4.  Pour the white wine, olive oil and water into the bowl.

5.  Mix all the ingredients together.

6.  Put the mixture into a large baking dish and cook it in a preheated 350°F oven for 40 minutes.

7.  Serve it hot.

1 kg chicken breasts, cut into small pieces

100 g onions, finely chopped

100 g tomatoes, finely chopped

1 tbsp ginger, grated

1 tbsp turmeric

1 tbsp curry leaves

1 tbsp cumin

1 tbsp coriander

1 tbsp salt

250 g natural yogurt

### Response:
outputs:
Sure, I can help you out!  Fenalar is a traditional Norwegian lamb dish.  It's a fairly simple recipe, and you can find variations with beef or fish, too.  Here's a recipe:

Fenalar

1 kg lamb

100 g butter

100 g flour

1 tsp salt

1 tsp allspice

1 tsp white pepper

100 g water

100 g yogurt

100 g sour cream

100 g heavy cream

1.  Cut the meat into pieces.

2.  Make holes in the meat with a spoon, and set aside.

3.  Melt the butter.

4.  Add the flour, salt, allspice and white pepper.

5.  Mix it into a paste.

6.  Put the meat into a pot, and cover with the paste.

7.  Cook the meat on low heat for 15 minutes.

8.  Add the water, yogurt, sour cream, heavy cream and salt.

9.  Cook for another 15 minutes.

10. Serve with potatoes and a green salad.

Chinup: Position yourself facing away from the dipping board, with your feet shoulder width apart. Place your hands on the dipping board, facing away from you. Pause briefly at the bottom, then come back up again, going slowly and making sure to keep your back straight.

Squat: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, and relax. Slowly lower yourself down, which will stretch your quads and hamstrings, until your thighs are parallel to the ground. Pause briefly at the bottom, then come back up again, going slowly and making sure to keep your back straight.

Ingredients

1 egg

1/4 cup flour

1/4 cup sugar

1/2 cup milk

1/2 cup olive oil

1/2 tsp vanilla

1/2 tsp cinnamon

1/2 tsp nutmeg

1/4 tsp cloves

1/4 tsp salt

Method

5.  Bake at 350F for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

6.  Serve warm.

### Instructions: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Tunisian dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Lablabi?

### Response:
outputs:
Sure, I can help! Lablabi is a traditional Tunisian dish, and it’s really popular in the city of Tunis. It’s a thick, spiced tomato-and-pepper-based sauce, which is served with a variety of mezze dishes. Here’s a basic recipe:

1 onion, finely chopped

2 tomatoes, peeled, seeded and chopped

1 red pepper, finely chopped

1/2 tsp ground cumin

1/2 tsp ground coriander

1/2 tsp ground cinnamon

1/2 tsp ground cloves

1/2 tsp ground nutmeg

1/2 tsp ground allspice

1/2 tsp ground cardamom

1/2 tsp ground ginger

1/2 tsp ground turmeric

1/2 tsp salt

1/2 tsp black pepper

2 tbsp olive oil

1 tbsp pomegranate molasses

1 tbsp sugar

1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley

1/2 cup chopped fresh mint

1/2 cup chopped fresh coriander

Place the onion, tomatoes, red pepper and spices in a pot over medium heat. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the olive oil, pomegranate molasses, sugar and salt. Cook for another 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the parsley, mint and coriander and cook for 5 more minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool, then blend until smooth.

This is useful for many reasons, like browsing the web privately, and makes it so your computer doesn’t send out your location and web browsing history to the rest of the internet.  VPNs work using “tunnels” to encrypt your traffic as it goes to and from the VPN server.

### Instructions: what are some good stretches i should do before going to the gym?

### Response:
outputs:
I could give you a list of stretches, or we could have a more targeted conversation.  I know that some of the best stretches are actually specific to the muscles you’re going to be using at the gym, so it might help to know what you’re about to do.  That said, here are a few that I know:

1.  The “camel stretch”: This is a classic stretch for the hip flexors, which are the muscles you use to lift your legs.  To do it, get down on your hands and knees, then lift your heels off the ground and pull your knees towards the ground.  You should feel a stretch in the top of your thighs and in your hip flexors.  You can do this one with your knees on the ground if you’re having trouble.

2.  The “child’s stretch”: This is a good stretch for the hamstrings, which are the muscles that run along your outer thigh.  To do it, get down on your hands and knees, then reach your arms out in front of you.  Then, keep your heels lifted and start to bend your knees, bringing your heels towards the ground.  You should feel a stretch in your hamstrings.  If you want to go deeper, keep bending your knees until you can’t go any farther.  You can do this one with your knees on the ground if you’re having trouble.

3.  The “runner’s stretch”: This is a good stretch for the calf muscle, which is located on the back of your leg.
